article_node.title: Parents of kids swept away in Texas floods beg lawmakers to protect future campers
article_node.summary: A July 4 flood in the Texas Hill Country swept away 27 children and several counselors at Camp Mystic, prompting parents like Michael McCown to demand a new safety bill that would keep cabins out of flood plains, require emergency plans, and mandate weather radios. The camp’s buildings were in a 100‑year flood plain, but FEMA had removed 15 from the hazard map in 2013, and the camp’s head may have missed an emergency alert. One child, Linnie, was found dead, while another, Cile Steward, remains missing. Texas lawmakers are considering the “Heaven’s 27 Camp Safety Act” to prevent future tragedies and honor the victims.
